title: Shannon-Hartley Channel Capacity Theorem

steps.title: Channel Capacity Definition
steps.description: Channel capacity is the maximum rate of reliable information transmission.
steps.explanation: Where I(X;Y) is the mutual information between input X and output Y

steps.title: Gaussian Channel Model
steps.description: For an AWGN channel: Y = X + N, where N ~ N(0, σ²)
steps.explanation: The mutual information is the output entropy minus the noise entropy

steps.title: Maximize Over Input Distribution
steps.description: The capacity is achieved when X ~ N(0, P) is Gaussian
steps.explanation: Gaussian input maximizes differential entropy for given power constraint

steps.title: Shannon-Hartley Formula
steps.explanation: For bandwidth B: C = B log₂(1 + SNR) bits/second

steps.title: Bandwidth and Power Tradeoff
steps.explanation: As B→∞, C approaches (S/N₀)ln(2). We can trade bandwidth for power and vice versa.

key_results: Fundamental limit on data rate for given bandwidth and SNR
Achievable with Gaussian codebooks and optimal coding
No error-free transmission possible above capacity
assumptions: Infinite block length (arbitrarily small error probability)
